alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Estill; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:40PM EDT until May 07 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY FOR ESTILL, SOUTHWESTERN BREATHITT, LEE AND NORTHERN OWSLEY COUNTIES... At 940 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rains still ongoing across the warned area. Excessive runoff from previous heavy rainfall is still capable of causing flash flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Irvine, Jackson, Beattyville, Booneville, Fincastle, Ravenna, Enoch, St. Helens, Grass, Maloney, Stay, Lower Buffalo, Airedale, Lone, Monica, Tallega, Corgleton, Primrose, Proctor and Canyon Falls. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
